description: Z-code files use a programming language called the Zork Implementation Language (Zork was Infocom's first game). The file extensions use a numerical value for the version of the Z-machine that is used to run them. Examples include the .Z1 , .Z2 , .Z4 , .Z5 , .Z6 , .Z7 , and .Z8 extensions. Since version 8 was the last Z-machine version, Z8 is the most popular of the extensions.
NOTE: Z3 files are much more common than Z1 and Z2 files but less common than later versions like the Z5 and Z8 extensions.
